page.title: 09Leighfield non-arable farm 1
page.content: 50 acres of grassland to the north of Priors Coppice(833055) has been used as a stud, breeding horses for flat racing, National Hunt racing and riding horses. A range of 10 loose boxes and hay barn(836057) were used for the mares and foals. The land and buildings are presently for sale as the owner considers that the economic situation has made horse breeding an unviable proposition. He estimates the cost of producing a foal to be Â£1000 per year making a four year old worth Â£4000, a price no one is prepared to pay. As well as horses the grassland is grazed by sheep and bullocks in order to keep it in good condition and reduce the problem of internal parasites.
